Package ohos.bundle

Class AbilityInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.bundle.AbilityInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public class AbilityInfo
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Obtains configuration information about an ability.

    1

    • Method Detail

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel​()
        Obtains the name of an ability that is visible to users or the resource index of the ability name.

        You can configure the label tag in the configuration file. The default value is the value of the name tag, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the ability name visible to users.
        Since:
        1

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription​()
        Obtains the description of an ability.

        The description of an ability can be a character string, or a resource index of the description. You can configure the description in the configuration file. The default value is an empty string, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the description of the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getIconPath

        public String getIconPath​()
        Obtains the path where the icon resource file of an ability is saved.

        You can configure the icon tag in the configuration file. The default value is an empty string, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the path storing the icon resource file of the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible​()
        Checks whether an ability can be called by other abilities.

        You can configure the visible tag in the configuration file. The default value is false, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the ability can be called by other abilities; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getType

        public AbilityInfo.AbilityType getType​()
        Obtains the type of templates used by an ability.

        Ability has three types of templates: AbilityType#PAGE with a UI, AbilityType#SERVICE without a UI, and AbilityType#DATA that provides data access services. The type tag must be specified. You must have configured it in the configuration file.

        Returns:
        Returns the type of templates used by the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getOrientation

        public AbilityInfo.DisplayOrientation getOrientation​()
        Obtains the display orientation of an ability.

        orientation is valid only for abilities using the Page template. It can be any of the following values:

        • DisplayOrientation#UNSPECIFIED: The system automatically determines the display orientation of an ability.
        • DisplayOrientation#LANDSCAPE: An ability is displayed in landscape orientation.
        • DisplayOrientation#PORTRAIT: An ability is displayed in portrait orientation.
        • DisplayOrientation#FOLLOWRECENT: An ability is displayed orientation same as the recent ability in stack.

        You can configure this tag in the configuration file. The default value is unspecified, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the display orientation of the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getLaunchMode

        public AbilityInfo.LaunchMode getLaunchMode​()
        Obtains the launch mode of an ability, either singleton or standard.

        In LaunchMode#STANDARD pattern, an ability can have multiple instances, while in LaunchMode#SINGLETON pattern, an ability has only a single instance. You can configure the launch-mode tag in the configuration file. The default value is singleton, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the launch mode of the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getBundleName

        public String getBundleName​()
        Obtains the name of the bundle containing the ability.
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the bundle containing the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getClassName

        public String getClassName​()
        Obtains the class name of an ability.

        The class name is formed by combining the bundle name and the value of the name tag of the ability.

        Returns:
        Returns the class name of the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getOriginalClassName

        public String getOriginalClassName​()
        Obtains the original class name of an ability.

        The shell class name is formed by combining the shell bundle name and the value of the name tag of the shell ability.

        Returns:
        Returns the class name of the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getPermissions

        public List<String> getPermissions​()
        Obtains the permissions required for other abilities to call the current ability.

        Each permission must be a character string, which is usually a reverse domain name. You can specify either predefined permissions or permissions customized by the application. The name of a customized permission specified in this tag must be the same as the value of name of a permission defined in the def-permissions tag. You can configure the permissions tag in the configuration file. The default value is an empty list, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the list of permissions required for other abilities to call the current ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getDeviceTypes

        public List<String> getDeviceTypes​()
        Obtains the types of devices where an ability can run.

        device-type specifies the types of devices running an ability. The predefined types are tv, pc, car, and watch. You can configure this tag in the configuration file.

        Returns:
        Returns the list of device types that can run the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getDeviceCapabilities

        public List<String> getDeviceCapabilities​()
        Obtains the device capabilities required for running an ability.

        device-capability indicates the capabilities that a device should have for running an ability. The capabilities must be consistent with those described in the profile file of the device. You can configure this tag in the configuration file. The default value is an empty list, indicating that no device capabilities are required for running the ability, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns the device capabilities required for running the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getURI

        public String getURI​()
        Obtains the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of an ability.
        Returns:
        Returns the URI of the ability; returns an empty string if the URI is not configured.
        Since:
        1

        Judge whether the ability is in harmony transition stage.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ability is in harmony transition stage; returns false otherwise.

      • getModuleName

        public String getModuleName​()
        Obtains the module-name tag of an ability.

        module-name indicates the name of the HAP file which the ability belongs to. This tag is automatically generated by the IDE.

        Returns:
        Returns the name of the HAP file.
        Since:
        1

      • getProcess

        public String getProcess​()
        Obtains the name of the process where this ability should run.

        The process name is set in the process attribute of this ability in the config.json file. If it is not set, the process attribute set for the application is used by default.

        Returns:
        Returns the process name.
        Since:
        3

      • getTargetAbility

        public String getTargetAbility​()
        Obtains the target ability that this ability points to.

        If you have set the targetAbility attribute for this ability in config.json, this ability is only an ability alias, and the ability specified by targetAbility is the real ability it points to. If the specified target ability cannot be found in the current bundle, config.json will fail to be parsed.

        Returns:
        Returns the class name of the target ability.
        Since:
        3

      • getFormEnabled

        public boolean getFormEnabled​()
        Obtains the formEnabled tag of an ability.

        formEnabled specifies whether AbilityForm is enabled for an ability using the Page template. Do not set this tag to true for abilities using any other template. The default value is false, and you can retain the default value.

        Returns:
        Returns true if AbilityForm is enabled for the ability; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getBackgroundModes

        public int getBackgroundModes​()
        Obtains the backgroundModes tag of an ability.

        backgroundModes is dedicated to abilities using the Service template. You can use this tag to assign one or more background service modes to an ability. The available background modes and their respective tag values are as follows:

        • data-transfer: Service for downloading, backing up, sharing, or transferring data from the network or peer devices. The tag value is 0b00000001.
        • audio-playback: Audio output service. The tag value is 0b00000010.
        • audio-recording: Audio input service. The tag value is 0b00000010.
        • picture-in-picture: Picture-in-picture and small-window video playback services. The tag value is 0b00000010.
        • voip: Voice/video call and VoIP services. The tag value is 0b00000100.
        • Location: Location and navigation services. The tag value is 0b00001000.
        • bluetooth-interaction: Bluetooth-based scanning, connection, and transmission services (for wearable devices). The tag value is 0b00010000.
        • wifi-interaction: WLAN-based scanning, connection, and transmission services. The tag value is 0b00010000.
        • screen-fetch: Screen recording and screenshot services. The tag value is 0b00100000.

        The final tag value can be the sum of multiple preceding values. You need to use a single value, for example, 0b00000010 or 0b00010000, only once in this tag for your application to have all background modes corresponding to that value.

        Returns:
        Returns an integer as the sum of all values set for the ability.
        Since:
        1

      • getApplicationInfo

        public ApplicationInfo getApplicationInfo​()
        Obtains information about the current application.
        Returns:
        Returns the ApplicationInfo object for the current application.
        Since:
        1

      • getFormEntity

        public int getFormEntity​()
        Obtains the area where an AbilityForm can be displayed.
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if the AbilityForm can be displayed on the home screen; returns 2 if it can be displayed on the search interface; returns 3 if it can be displayed on both areas.
        Since:
        1

      • getMinFormHeight

        public int getMinFormHeight​()
        Obtains the minimum height of an AbilityForm.

        The initial value is 0. If formEnabled is set to false, this method is invalid.

        Returns:
        Returns the minimum height (in pixels) of the AbilityForm.
        Since:
        1
